info.name: Pokemon3D API
info.description: This API provides access to 3D models of Pok√©mon, specifically in the GLB format. It's designed to be used with the [Pokemon3D ](https://github.com/Sudhanshu-Ambastha/Pokemon-3D) project found on GitHub. The API allows you to easily retrieve the necessary 3D model data for use within this project, enabling you to integrate and display interactive Pok√©mon models within your applications.

request.description: This URL accesses an API endpoint that retrieves a comprehensive list of all Pok√©mon. It fetches data from various Pok√©mon collections, including regular, shiny, and other forms, providing a complete overview of the available Pok√©mon data.

This URL accesses an API endpoint that specifically retrieves data for **Regular** Pok√©mon. It queries the database for all entries within the "RegularPokemon" collection, providing information about all standard, non-variant forms of Pok√©mon (id limit=721).

(‚úÖ: all models present till 721 or till gen 6)

This URL accesses an API endpoint that specifically retrieves data for **Shiny** Pok√©mon. It queries the database for all entries within the "ShinyPokemon" collection, providing information about all Shiny variants of Pok√©mon

(üöß: models needed)

This URL accesses an API endpoint that specifically retrieves data for **Alolan** forms of Pok√©mon. It queries the database for all entries within the "AlolanPokemon" collection, providing information about Pok√©mon with unique characteristics found in the Alola region.

(üöß: models needed)

This URL accesses an API endpoint that specifically retrieves data for **Hisuian** forms of Pok√©mon. It queries the database for all entries within the "HisuianPokemon" collection, providing information about Pok√©mon with unique characteristics found in the Hisui region (now known as the Sinnoh region)

(‚úÖ: all models present)

This URL accesses an API endpoint that specifically retrieves data for **Galar** forms of Pok√©mon. It queries the database for all entries within the "GalarPokemon" collection, providing information about Pok√©mon with unique characteristics found in the Galar region

(üöß: models needed)

Primal Pok√©mon are legendary Pok√©mon that can undergo a powerful transformation, gaining increased strength and altered appearances. This transformation, known as Primal Reversion, is triggered by specific conditions and grants them immense power

(‚úÖ: all models present)

This URL accesses an API endpoint that specifically retrieves data for **Primal** forms of Pok√©mon. It queries the database for all entries within the "PrimalPokemon" collection, providing information about Pok√©mon that can undergo a Primal Reversion, such as Primal Groudon and Primal Kyogre

(‚úÖ: all models present)

This URL accesses an API endpoint that specifically retrieves data for **Mega** forms of Pok√©mon. It queries the database for all entries within the "MegaPokemon" collection, providing information about Pok√©mon that can Mega Evolve through the use of Mega Stones

(‚úÖ: all models present)

This URL accesses an API endpoint that specifically retrieves data for Pok√©mon introduced in the **Pok√©mon X and Y** games. It queries the database for all entries within the "XyPokemon" collection, providing information about the Pok√©mon that were first introduced in the Kalos region

(‚úÖ: all models present)

This URL accesses an API endpoint that specifically retrieves data for **Gigantamax** forms of Pok√©mon. It queries the database for all entries within the "GmaxPokemon" collection, providing information about Pok√©mon that can undergo Gigantamaxing in the Galar region

(üöß: models needed)
